oru.inf

Class InfDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • oru.inf.InfDB

  • public class InfDB
extends java.lang.Object
    Class managing the underlying database (Firebird). Created by Nicklas Magnusson on 2014-05-11. Project: InfDB
    Version:
    0.2
    Author:
    Nicklas Magnusson nicmav141@studentmail.oru.se

    • Constructor Detail

      • InfDB

        public InfDB(java.lang.String path)
      throws InfException
        InfDB Constructor for the DB class initiates a default connection to the database, with SQL AS statement on (columnLabelForName).

        Example:
        private InfDB db;
        db = new InfDB("path/to/db.fdb");

        Parameters:
        path - Path to the Firebird DB, for example C:/DB.FDB or for Mac /User/DB.FDB
        Throws:
        InfException - If the DB connection couldn't be established.

      • InfDB

        public InfDB(java.lang.String path,
             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> param)
      throws InfException
        InfDB Constructor for the DB class initiates a non default connection to the database.

        Example:
        private InfDB dba;
        HashMap<String,Object> options = InfDBHelper.getAdvanceParams();
        dba = new InfDB("path/to/db.fdb", options);

        Parameters:
        path - Path to the Firebird DB, for example C:/DB.FDB or for Mac /User/DB.FDB
        param - Parameters used to establish a connection to the database (Use InfDBHelper getAdvanceParams())
        Throws:
        InfException - If the DB connection couldn't be established.

    • Method Detail

      • fetchSingle

        public java.lang.String fetchSingle(java.lang.String query)
                             throws InfException
        Fetches a single value from the DB, if the query returns several values, the first one is selected.

        Example:
        String name = db.fetchSingle("select name from agent where id=1");

        Parameters:
        query - SQL query for the DB
        Returns:
        a String containing the value.
        Throws:
        InfException - If the query doesn't work an error is thrown.

      • fetchColumn

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> fetchColumn(java.lang.String query)
                                                  throws InfException
        Fetches a column from the DB, if the query returns several columns, the first one is selected.

        Example:
        ArrayList<String> names = db.fetchColumn("select name from agent");

        Parameters:
        query - SQL query for the DB
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the columns row values.
        Throws:
        InfException - If the query doesn't work an error is thrown.

      • fetchRow

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fetchRow(java.lang.String query)
                                                              throws InfException
        Fetches one row from the DB, if the query has several rows the first one is selected.

        Example:
        HashMap<String,String> agent = db.fetchRow("select * from agent where id=1");

        Parameters:
        query - SQL query for the DB
        Returns:
        A HashMap containing the rows values with the columns "name" as their key.
        Throws:
        InfException - If the query doesn't work an error is thrown.

      • fetchRows

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> fetchRows(java.lang.String query)
                                                                                    throws InfException
        Fetches 1 to N number of rows from the DB into an ArrayList of HashMaps where the ArrayList index is the row and the HashMap contains the rows values with the columns "NAME" as its key.

        Example:
        ArrayList<HashMap<String,String>> allAgents = db.fetchRows("select * from agent");

        Parameters:
        query - SQL query for the DB
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of HashMaps where the ArrayList is the rows number and the HashMap the rows values with the columns "name" as their key.
        Throws:
        InfException - If the query doesn't work an error is thrown.

      • getAutoIncrement

        public java.lang.String getAutoIncrement(java.lang.String table,
                                         java.lang.String attribute)
                                  throws InfException
        Retrieves and counts a number upwards for a column that contains Integers, to simulate an incrementing number. Also works on columns containing letters+numbers(or numbers+letters) by replicating the letters and counting the number upwards.

        Example:
        String nextId = db.getAutoIncrement("agent","id");

        Parameters:
        table - The table where the number(ID) is located
        attribute - The column name in the table of the number(ID)
        Returns:
        returns the number(ID) +1
        Throws:
        InfException - If the query didn't work or a column contains something else than numbers or letters+numbers an error is thrown.

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.String query)
            throws InfException
        Inserting a row into the DB using SQL syntax INSERT INTO.

        Example:
        db.insert("insert into agent values(1,'Mr Wiggles')");

        Parameters:
        query - SQL query for the DB
        Throws:
        InfException - If insert isn't correctly formatted throws an error

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String query)
            throws InfException
        Deleting a row from the DB using SQL syntax DELETE FROM.

        Example:
        db.delete("delete from agent where id=1");

        Parameters:
        query - SQL query for the DB
        Throws:
        InfException - If delete isn't correctly formatted throws an error

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String query)
            throws InfException
        Updating a row or value in the DB using SQL syntax UPDATE ... SET

        Example:
        db.update("update agent set name='Scooter the Snail' where id=1");

        Parameters:
        query - SQL query for the DB
        Throws:
        InfException - If update isn't correctly formatted throws an error

      • getResultSet

        public java.sql.ResultSet getResultSet(java.lang.String query)
                                throws InfException
        Get a ResultSet of the query. The ResultSet is scrollable, insensitive(it doesn't take into account if the data in the database has been changed since the ResultSet was fetched) and updatable.
        You must be in advanced mode to use this, connecting using InfDBHelper getAdvanceParams()
        Will return null if no results could be found with the query.
        Doesn't close the database connection after the ResultSet is returned.
        How to use: see Java API docs: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/ResultSet.html

        There are a few conditions that are in place for the ResultSet to be updatable:
        - the SELECT statement that generated the result set references only one table;
        - all columns that are not referenced by the SELECT statement allow NULL values, otherwise it won't be possible to insert new rows;
        - the SELECT statement does not contain DISTINCT predicate, aggregate functions, joined tables or stored procedures;
        - the SELECT statement references all columns from the table primary key definition or the RDB$DB_KEY column.

        Hints/examples:
        cursor moves: next(), previous(), absolute(**index**).
        getters: getString(**columnindex**), getInt(**columnindex**)
        updates: updateRow(), updateInt(), updateString().
        inserts: moveToInsertRow(), insertRow(). // after updating values with updates
        deletes: deleteRow()

        Parameters:
        query - the SQL query
        Returns:
        ResultSet with the results of the query
        Throws:
        InfException - if something went wrong with the query.
